intro: Schizoloma pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf milkweed, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and along stream banks. Schizoloma pumilum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
